1.text: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.

2.text: Why I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.

3.text: Yes, better is he than both they, which has not yet been, who has not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.

4.text: Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbor. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.

5.text: The fool folds his hands together, and eats his own flesh.

6.text: Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit.

7.text: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.

8.text: There is one alone, and there is not a second; yes, he has neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labor; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither said he, For whom do I labor, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yes, it is a sore travail.

9.text: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labor.

10.text: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falls; for he has not another to help him up.

11.text: Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone?

12.text: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

13.text: Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.

14.text: For out of prison he comes to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becomes poor.

15.text: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.

16.text: There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.
